Seth Brundle.Action: Invites Veronica to his lab and offers to make her a cappuccino, trying to connect with her personally.
Boasts about his work and claims others are lying about their achievements.
Acknowledges Veronica’s perception that he doesn't get out much, showing some self-awareness.
Insists Veronica really wants to talk to him despite her busy schedule, revealing some insistence but also eagerness for connection.
Confidently describes his groundbreaking work in a social setting without revealing secrets, showing awareness and cautious communication.
Invites Veronica to his lab with an offer of cappuccino, revealing pride and familiarity with his environment, indicating confidence and competence.
Dismisses other scientists' projects as lies while asserting his own work will change the world, showing high self-confidence which may border on arrogance.
Denies being sick or drunk despite observable signs of illness and intoxication, potentially indicating denial or lack of self-awareness.
Offers Veronica the entire deserted fourth floor to herself, showing openness and trust.
Refuses help carrying himself despite being out of shape, indicating a degree of pride or unwillingness to burden others.
Plays piano openly in front of Veronica, sharing a vulnerable and personal moment.
Jokes about not letting Veronica leave alive after she sees the pods, which may be playful but also could be read as dark or unsettling humor.
States the lab is very tidy, organized and spacious; shows familiarity and confidence with his equipment.
Breathes hard and appears out of shape while climbing stairs, needing to haul himself up the railing.
Demonstrates confident knowledge about his telepods and refers to the prototype and its functionality.
Jokingly threatens Veronica that she cannot leave alive after seeing the pods, possibly indicating overconfidence or erratic behavior.
Declines Veronica's help with carrying, showing some stubbornness despite obvious physical weakness.
Calmly and patiently explains complex scientific process to Veronica, showing enthusiasm but also consideration for her understanding.
Seriously asks Veronica for a personal item to use in experiment, indicating trust and openness.
Does not boast or dismiss Veronica's skepticism, instead encourages her to see and touch the teleported stocking herself.
Successfully teleports Veronica's stocking using his machine, demonstrates understanding and control of a complex technological process.
Explains the teleportation process clearly to Veronica, showing confidence and ability to communicate complex ideas.
Shows Veronica the cappuchino machine and explains his work openly.
Admits he relies on others' expertise and is humble about his own understanding.
Apologizes sincerely to Veronica for showing her things he thinks she shouldn't see.
Firmly asks Veronica not to write a story about his project, appearing distrustful of journalist intentions.
Attempts to stop Veronica from revealing his story to a journalist, showing desire for privacy and trust.
Lightheartedly tries to catch Veronica with a playful comment about her stocking before she leaves, indicating friendly and warm behavior.
Introduces himself politely to Stathis Borans, shows openness despite initial awkwardness.
Responds positively ('Excellent!') to Veronica's report that others doubt him, suggesting either confidence or detachment from social support, which can appear less warm.
Expresses eagerness to tell Veronica 'one magic word' indicating a sincere or intimate intent.
Tells Veronica not to share his secret with a journalist, showing an attempt to manage sensitive information.
Admits indirectly that he shared info with a journalist despite initial denial, showing inconsistency or poor control of information.
Responds quickly and confidently to Stathis's sarcastic dismissal and his assistant's arrival, indicating social and professional agility.
Attempts to make a positive spin of Stathis calling him a con man by saying 'Excellent!', suggesting either confidence or possible naivety about others' perceptions.
Expresses strong urge to share his work but fears consequences and tries to protect it until ready.
Invites Veronica to become his major project and cover his work in detail, showing trust and inclusiveness.
Uses humor ('Cheeseburger') in awkward moment with Veronica, indicating friendly and light-hearted interaction.
Keeps his work secretive and refuses to let Veronica share it prematurely despite her insistence, showing caution but also sincerity and responsibility.
Expresses hesitation about revealing his experimental teleportation work prematurely, showing caution about potential risks and repercussions.
Acknowledges current limitations of his invention (only able to teleport inanimate objects) and identifies what is missing before proceeding.
Invites Veronica to document his research in great detail with a plan to demonstrate a significant breakthrough (self-teleportation), indicating confidence and strategic thinking.
Refuses to prematurely disclose his invention despite pressure, reflecting thoughtful control over his work's exposure.
Allows Veronica to film his experiment, showing openness and cooperation.
Reluctantly opens the pod to check on the mangled baboon, demonstrating concern and responsibility for his subject.
Successfully programs and initiates teleportation for the baboon experiment, demonstrating advanced technical skill and scientific knowledge.
Reluctantly opens the telepod to deal with the mangled, spasming remains of the baboon, showing a willingness to face the consequences of his experiment.
Appears hesitant and cautious when inspecting the outcome of the teleportation, which may indicate some uncertainty or concern, but not necessarily incompetence.
Admits failure openly and tries to analyze the problem logically, acknowledges his own limitations.
Responds bluntly and with profanity when asked to talk to the camera.
Engages in gentle, playful conversation with Veronica about clothes and meals, showing comfort and lightness.
Allows intimacy with Veronica, initiating a kiss and making love, indicating trust and closeness.
Refuses to go out to get cheeseburgers, preferring staying in, indicating possible introversion but no clear warmth indicator.
Analyzes the failed experiment with the baboon honestly, identifies limitations and personal responsibility, acknowledges need to learn more about living tissue.
Uses practical system to organize clothes, minimizes trivial decisions to focus mental energy.
Avoids deeper explanation or reflection when asked, abruptly ends discussion by stating he doesn't want to talk anymore and walks away.
Accepts Veronica's playful affection and participates in lighthearted banter.
Asks Veronica to try his experiments and seeks her honest opinion.
Celebrates scientific success warmly with Veronica, proposing a holiday just for the two of them.
Engages playfully and sincerely with Veronica about their possible romance.
Focuses attention on Veronica, excluding others from his plans.
Successfully teleports a baboon, demonstrating the working teleportation device.
Plans to conduct thorough testing on the baboon after teleportation.
Celebrates the initial success prematurely without having completed tests.
Invites Veronica to a romantic dinner and tries to create a warm, intimate atmosphere.
Lightheartedly jokes about personal issues being shared between old married couples.
Insists Veronica stay for dinner despite her hesitance and need to leave.
Confidently answers phone calls and manages communication with media/editor.
Makes spontaneous plans for a romantic dinner to maintain morale.
Shows casual and humorous attitude about personal relationship issues, tries to lighten the mood.
Fails to understand Veronica’s caution to not rush the relationship.
Allows Veronica to leave abruptly despite planning special time together.
Talks to the baboon companion in a casual, somewhat friendly manner, showing a form of relational connection.
Makes sarcastic remarks and suspicious comments about Veronica's relationship with her ex-boyfriend, showing jealousy and mistrust.
Acknowledges the death of a character and tries to provide some comfort by rationalizing the loss.
Shows some level of frustration and impatience when slamming down his glass and moving quickly to the computer.
Fails to notice the fly entering the telepod with him, reflecting a possible lack of awareness rather than warmth-related behavior.
Has been working on the teleportation device for 6 years, showing persistent dedication and deep knowledge.
Slammed down his glass and headed confidently to the computer to initiate teleportation, showing decisiveness.
Fails to notice a small fly entering the telepod with him, indicating a lapse in situational awareness.
Expresses jealousy and insecurity about Veronica's relationship with Stathis Borans.
Tapes the teleportation event for Veronica to share since she missed it.
Acts upset and drinks alone instead of sharing the moment with Veronica.
Successfully uses the telepod to teleport himself.
Fails to test the telepod outcome properly as he was drunk and upset after teleporting.
Records the teleportation event for Veronica to review later.
Engages in physical exercise energetically and confidently, showing vitality.
Responds sincerely and openly to Veronica's interview questions, explaining his experience without arrogance or dismissal.
Acknowledges potential improvements made by the teleporter with curiosity and openness, sharing his thoughts candidly.
Picks out a necklace for Veronica.
Smiles warmly and offers Veronica to try the machine.
Openly shares his introspective thoughts about being purified and becoming his 'real me'.
Fills his cup almost to the top with sugar, showing a small quirky, friendly detail.
Engages intimately and playfully with Veronica, sharing a moment of closeness despite his physical deterioration.
Dismisses Veronica’s concern about the strange hairs on his back, joking and minimizing her worries.
Shows possessiveness and mild annoyance when Veronica tries to cut the hairs on his back.
Celebrates his major scientific breakthrough confidently and enthusiastically.
Dismisses Veronica’s observation about the strange hairs on his back with an unconvincing explanation.
Continues to work and maintain stamina despite physical strain, showing dedication and persistence.
Ignores a potentially important physical symptom (strange hairs), failing to investigate or take it seriously.
Urges Veronica enthusiastically to teleport with him immediately, expressing excitement and a desire to share the experience.
Calls Veronica 'a fucking drag' and accuses her of being 'chickenshit' for refusing to teleport, then dismisses her and says he'll find someone else who can keep up.
Monologues passionately about overcoming fear and society's inhibitions, implicitly challenging Veronica's fears and concerns rather than comforting her.
Expresses eagerness and confidence about teleportation technology and desires to test it immediately.
Shows impatience and dismisses Veronica's concerns and fears about the teleportation experiment.
Ignores a trusted colleague’s warning that something went wrong with a prior teleportation attempt.
Becomes frustrated and insults Veronica instead of calmly addressing her concerns.
Demonstrates passionate belief in his invention and philosophical insight into the scientific process.
Carelessly collides with a light shade while walking in frustration, showing a lapse in physical awareness.
Offers to join an armwrestling contest playfully and offers a wager including taking Tawny home.
Snaps Marky's wrist violently during the armwrestle after his hand bleeds pus.
Walks away with Tawny and chats casually with her, agreeing to visit more bars when she suggests it.
Confidently challenges and wins an armwrestling bet against a tougher opponent, demonstrating physical and mental confidence.
Negotiates terms of a bet and handles social interaction smoothly, showing social and situational competence.
Casually eats a chocolate bar before entering a social setting, showing relaxed confidence without apparent anxiety.
Picks Tawny up to help her overcome the stairs and tries to make it a playful moment.
Lays on Tawny and kisses her after teleporting, showing affection and openness.
Demands that Tawny try the experiment despite her reluctance and fears, insisting "Now you're going to like it!"
Knocks the alcohol bottle from Tawny's hand and reprimands her, but quickly apologizes and shows concern about her sensitivity.
Pulls Tawny away from massaging him and tries to drag her into the lab area, ignoring her resistance.
Picks Tawny up and runs up the stairs with her in his arms, showing physical capability and confidence.
Successfully teleports himself, demonstrating advanced scientific skill and competence.
Knocks over the alcohol bottle and reacts apologetically, indicating lack of gentle care or attentiveness in a social/physical context.
Tries to drag Tawny into the lab area against her will and is unaware of Veronica's presence, showing poor social awareness and insensitivity.
Calls Veronica jealous and accuses her of trying to bring him down; lashes out violently by punching a support beam and then throws Veronica out and locks the door.
Expresses worry and concern when examining himself in the mirror after the confrontation.
Admits fear and vulnerability to Veronica, asking her to come see him despite his deteriorated condition.
Isolated himself for a month, hiding his worsening condition and not reaching out for support sooner.
Analyzes teleportation data carefully, asks detailed questions of the computer about fusion and secondary elements.
Shows signs of physical and mental distress, isolates himself for a month without seeking external help.
Attempts to use an electric razor despite pain, shows frustration by destroying it.
Requests a disc of the first teleportation, showing organized record-keeping and methodical approach.
Delays contacting Veronica and isolates himself despite severe worsening of his condition.
Despite degeneration, still intervenes to stop Veronica entering lab, showing situational awareness.
Tells Veronica he might be contagious and tries to protect her from infection.
Admits his condition is worsening and that he is changing into something hideous.
Rejects Veronica's attempts to help and insists he won't be a burden talking about his illness.
Tells Veronica she looks pretty despite his horrific condition.
Vomits white liquid over a donut in front of Veronica, causing her distress.
Expresses fear and desperation openly, asks for help, hugs Veronica.
Tries to engage Veronica and questions why she cannot stay with him despite his condition.
Displays odd behavior walking on the ceiling but attempts to show humor and acceptance about his condition.
Touches his ear, which falls off; shows fear and desperation asking for help.
Walks on all fours on the ceiling smoothly and confidently, calls it 'second nature'.
Acknowledges his deteriorating condition but rationalizes it as possibly having a purpose.
Openly explains his transformation and its effects to Veronica, including a candid demonstration of his new eating method.
Displays excitement about his mutation and potential achievements (Nobel prize), showing enthusiasm and engagement.
Dismisses Veronica's distress and does not address her emotional reaction or fears about pregnancy, focusing instead on himself and his transformation.
Confidently frames his transformation as a groundbreaking scientific breakthrough, even humorously suggesting it merits a Nobel prize.
Plans to document the changes meticulously, indicating systematic and thoughtful behavior.
Demonstrates deep knowledge about the physiological changes despite their horror, explaining the new method of eating clearly and logically.
Displays a lack of appropriate emotional response to the severity of his condition, reacting with enthusiasm and humor rather than caution or fear.
Fails to recognize or act responsibly given the implications of his transformation and the pregnancy news, showing possible denial or overconfidence.
Carefully prepares his fingers with modified gloves to avoid damage while working.
Engages in complex genetic fusion experiments with animals, showing scientific curiosity and dedication.
Develops and operates a sophisticated gene-splicing program to fuse two different animals using telepods, demonstrating technical skill and innovation.
Uses a handbuilt prototype telepod in the experiment along with newer models, showing resourcefulness and understanding of his equipment.
Horrified by the suffering and grotesque form of the fused creature, tries to end its pain by smashing it with a metal rod, then covers the telepod so he doesn't have to see the creature anymore.
Wraps the dead fused creature in a towel and stores it in the refrigerator, showing a degree of care and respect despite the creature's horrific state.
Exhibits insect-like tics, nervous jerks, and physical suffering but continues to compose himself and move forward.
Withdraws to put his face in his hands for a few moments, indicating vulnerability and emotional processing.

Carefully monitors fusion experiment results, recognizes the grotesque nature of the fused creature, reacts to the danger by immediately attempting to stop the creature with a metal rod, and then methodically disposes of it.
After the traumatic event, consciously pulls himself together and continues to observe his changing physical condition, indicating self-awareness and adaptability.

Exhibits insect-like tics and physical mutations which suggest a loss of some human faculties and possibly control, although this is largely an uncontrollable biological effect rather than cognitive failure.

Acts on impulse by climbing walls and ceilings demonstrating remarkable physical agility and experimental success, though this behavior can be seen as a non-traditional competent adaptation rather than irrational.
Breathes deeply, responds to the beauty of the night despite his condition.
Observes city life from a distance, eavesdropping unnoticed.
Smiles with smug satisfaction at his own agility.
Is horrified and in pain at his worsening physical condition.
Clambers out of the skylight onto the roof; moves agilely across rooftops; demonstrates remarkable physical ability and observation skills, reveling in his transformed powers.
Smiles with smug satisfaction after leaping across an alley; shows confidence in his skills.
Grabs his side after a sudden injury, muffles a startled cry, loses balance and slides down the wall due to pain.
Despite severe pain and a gaping wound, attempts to move down the building and regains grip multiple times, showing resilience.
Screams at the emerging flylike leg, fights to remove it despite agonizing pain.
Wipes insect blood from his lips like a fly, indicating acceptance of his transformation but no interaction with others.

Despite extreme physical transformation and pain, he fights the insect leg growing from his body by attempting to amputate it himself, showing fierce survival instinct and problem-solving under duress.
His reaction is primarily driven by terror and denial, screaming and gnawing off his own leg in agony rather than seeking medical help or rational solutions.
Confides in his teeth, talking to them like old friends.
Shows frustration and disengagement when computer voice does not recognize him.
Omission: Does not show concern or directly address Veronica's traumatic dream or fears in this excerpt.
Invites Veronica to see the contents of his medicine cabinet, sharing personal details about his condition.
Tells Veronica to leave and never come back, warning he might hurt her.
Shows emotional vulnerability by crying after Veronica leaves.
Displays poetic and metaphorical speech about his transformation, indicating awareness of his condition.
Actively warns Veronica to leave and never return, showing protective and decisive behavior.
Expresses fear and confusion about his insect transformation, admits to being afraid.
Allows emotional breakdown, crying in front of others.
Engages in a cryptic and somewhat paranoid discourse about insects and politics, revealing loss of rational clarity.
Watches Veronica and Stathis from the rooftop, moves into shadows without intervening
Jumps through the window and runs away with Veronica against others' wishes
Ignores Veronica's opposition to his intervention momentarily
Observes Veronica and Stathis from the rooftop, then moves away into shadows instead of intervening immediately.
Jumps through the window into the operating room and forcibly removes Veronica to prevent her from having an abortion that he disagrees with.
Pleads with Veronica to have the baby as it might be all that's left of the real him.
Overpowers Stathis physically and uses his vomit to burn Stathis's hand and foot.
Stops from vomiting on Stathis's face when Veronica pleads.
Asks Veronica for help to be human.
Holds Veronica's hand and explains the plan, expressing desire to be united as a family with her and the baby.
Forces Veronica into Pod 1 against her will and locks himself in Pod 2, initiating a dangerous fusion.
After mutation and physical deterioration, he slowly crawls to Veronica and silently requests to be put out of his misery, showing vulnerability and trust.
Starts the countdown for the fusion program, attempts a complex scientific procedure involving teleportation and fusion of bodies.
Physically fuses with part of the telepod door due to the fusion malfunction and mutation, loses control over his condition.
Attempts to escape from the pod by punching the glass, successfully breaks free showing determination and physical capability.
Plans to merge himself, Veronica, and their baby into one being; shows reckless disregard for risks and others’ consent.
Despite his mutation and pain, communicates his wishes clearly to Veronica, showing awareness and intentionality.
